paragraphs.text: That evening I returned with both boys to see her. Tanya was heavily sedated, but still managed to lift her head and open her eyes a few times when she heard our sons in the room. While I was telling the boys this was an encouraging sign, the nurse overheard me and said, “She’s been doing that all day.” I was livid. I was trying to give my kids some hope their mother would pull through this and she just shot me down. Later, I noticed our 14-year-old sitting on a chair in the room, a single tear running down his cheek. The memory still brings tears to my eyes.
paragraphs.name: 83f1

c7660f7ffeae.title: That was a very unwise thing to tell a grieving family.

paragraphs.text: That was a very unwise thing to tell a grieving family.
paragraphs.name: bcf1

paragraphs.text: I understand and always try to sympathise with health workers (especially in high stress environments, because fatigue makes you do stupid things), but this does make me feel angry and I’m sorry this happened to you.
paragraphs.name: 663a

9128139e1412.title: “ Phone calls not returned, redundant “are you sure” conversations, limiting the testing to one…

paragraphs.text: “ Phone calls not returned, redundant “are you sure” conversations, limiting the testing to one person at a time — all of it gave potential donors the feeling the hospital was trying to dissuade them.”
paragraphs.name: 64e2

paragraphs.text: This happend to me with my kidney transplant. It made me extremely mad. It’s like the hospital didn’t want me to get a…

d1ea660d3066.title: As a son whose mother passed away from organ failure — and will one day require an organ transplant…

paragraphs.text: As a son whose mother passed away from organ failure — and will one day require an organ transplant myself — I found this especially close to home. I wish nothing but the best for you and your sons. It is clear that Tanya was a wonderful wife and mother, and an incredible human being. Brian, thank you for sharing this deeply personal story.
paragraphs.name: 6fe6

daedb06e773c.title: First, sorry for your family’s loss, Brian.

paragraphs.text: First, sorry for your family’s loss, Brian. I too lost my wife while waiting for an experimental liver transplant in Illinois. She was 40 when she passed away leaving two young daughters. My wife had the same pancreatic cancer that Steve Jobs had and he received a liver transplant during the time my wife was diagnosed. As a result, we had hope…
paragraphs.name: 6ee3

virtuals.subtitle: Our emotional roller coaster of false hope while while watching my wife’s health decline eerily parallels your experience, Brian. Your post…

content.subtitle: Our emotional roller coaster of false hope while while watching my wife’s health decline eerily parallels your experience, Brian. Your post…

paragraphs.text: Thank you for sharing….. I’m in shock..living in NYC with the beginnings of fatty liver disease.. Alfa 1 carrier. {I found out by attending a COPD workshop} thank goodness I’m given the time to work this out. I heard about Oregon being a compassionate state. I feel this will be my heading. Thank you so very much
paragraphs.name: ff36

a065c7b868b.title: Wow. My heart goes out to you, I’m holding back tears.

paragraphs.text: Wow. My heart goes out to you, I’m holding back tears. This is truly a broken system, we need to fix it. Keep raising awareness.
paragraphs.name: f6eb

70c29ad97bc.title: Thank you for your honesty and bravery in sharing Tanya’s story and yours.

paragraphs.text: Thank you for your honesty and bravery in sharing Tanya’s story and yours. I am so very sorry for your loss, which I can empathize with more than I care to since my own wife died of liver disease at age 56 (she was six months older than Tanya) on January 19, in an ICU in a specialty hospital in San Antonio. Like Tanya, my wife was a brilliant and…
paragraphs.name: c219

dadb9237c0dd.title: Thanks Wes. So sorry for your loss. I’m told it gets easier. I’ll hold on to that.

paragraphs.text: Thanks Wes. So sorry for your loss. I’m told it gets easier. I’ll hold on to that.
paragraphs.name: b40c

paragraphs.text: Oh, Brian. I had no idea. Each paragraph brought new waves of grief for me. I cannot comprehend how you were able to write this. I continue to send love and light to you, B & Q and feel so honored, so grateful to have known the beauty and joy of Tanya.
paragraphs.name: e732

d0206c5e67cd.title: Heartbreaking story, thank you for sharing.

paragraphs.text: Heartbreaking story, thank you for sharing. I’m so sorry you went through this and the the broken system let you, your wife, and your sons down. My uncle was a heart transplant patient at the same hospital about 15 years ago. We know all about the waiting for someone to die dance. He received the heart of a 19 year old man who was killed in a car…

Thanks Bill. I’m sorry you had to go through this, as well. I intend to force some change in this system. The doctors who are a part of it know it’s broken, but they seem too beaten down to challenge it. I have a lot of friends, with a lot of connections, and I plan on using every one of them to make the transplant system better.
paragraphs.name: 3f11

8a6e42519bea.title: My heart is in a million pieces.

paragraphs.text: My heart is in a million pieces. I am so sorry you had to go through all of this, and that your children had to see it. The pictures broke me, but they made us all truly see what was going on. When my Aunt was sick with cancer in the hospital, the doctors and staff put her off as well. Not to the same extent, because things didn’t go back and forth…
paragraphs.name: 0b60

virtuals.subtitle: You are right about one thing. The system is very messed up.

content.subtitle: You are right about one thing. The system is very messed up.

2c0f81468dac.title: The worst thing about this was the rejection of your son as a donor.

paragraphs.text: The worst thing about this was the rejection of your son as a donor.
paragraphs.name: 7df9

paragraphs.text: That needs to change.
paragraphs.name: 626f

paragraphs.text: I cannot believe they wouldn’t allow an adult to be a donor in any capacity. He can vote. He is a legal adult. Why , oh why, could he not save his mothers life?
paragraphs.name: cdc0

paragraphs.text: This is so touching. Seems that the organ transplant situation is more or less similar, irrespective of on what part of the earth you are.The organ transplant issue needs to be addressed. Strength to you sir.
paragraphs.name: 3e76

9f9ba8e46a25.title: My condolences to you and your family.

paragraphs.text: My condolences to you and your family. I could literally feel the agony. Hope Noone has to undergo such hard times. And yes she is an inspiration. What a fighter! 💛
paragraphs.name: a40c

paragraphs.text: I am so sorry for this happening to you.
paragraphs.name: 862c

paragraphs.text: Here in Switzerland we have a different system. We carry the donor card with our personal belongings (I also wrote it down in my patient disposal so they can act quick if needed). I only hope due to lifelong medication some of my organs will still be good enough to help someone if I die too early.
paragraphs.name: 08cc

paragraphs.text: Wishing you all the best.
paragraphs.name: 3ef8

615cbbce0722.title: I know what you and your family went through.

paragraphs.text: I know what you and your family went through. I lost my husband at the age of 56 at New York Presbyterian Hospital. It will be 11 years on May 13th. My husband also had the same disease as your wife. He waited over 5 years for a liver. On May 5th, 2005 he had his transplant but only survived eight days. By the time a liver was found for him it was…
paragraphs.name: 66c4

42dcc49f48f5.title: Thank you for your vulnerable article, Brian.

paragraphs.text: Thank you for your vulnerable article, Brian. Broke my heart and was hard to read, especially knowing that there was a solution somewhere somehow. Prayers and love to you and yours…..
paragraphs.name: 9daa

96dd4413b9d.title: “Darling, we don’t die. We simply go on tour…”

paragraphs.text: “Darling, we don’t die. We simply go on tour…”
paragraphs.name: 95cb

54d97a02522.title: I am so sorry to hear of your loss, especially since there was such a wide mix of hope and elation…

paragraphs.text: I am so sorry to hear of your loss, especially since there was such a wide mix of hope and elation and disappointment and then hope, elation, etc all over again. Such an emotional roller coaster must have been hard to take for you and your wife and sons and the rest of your family. My heart and tears go out to you and I hope that this system will be…
paragraphs.name: 3b6d

d75a28724393.title: Breaks my heart reading this piece.

paragraphs.text: Breaks my heart reading this piece. My dad was diagnosed with amyeloidosis and he mirrored your wife’s experience. They couldn’t diagnose him correctly and now due to the lateness in diagnosis, his heart wall has increased by 4cm…our family are still very optimistic and battling with the disease. Definitely changes one’s perspective of life when…
paragraphs.name: b9cc

paragraphs.text: Thanks for sharing this Brian. I am so sorry you had to go through this. My dad had ALS. It was just so scary and frustrating to be so powerless as we watched him literally waste away from the disease.
Death changes your perspective on everything. Suddenly everything else in life seems so minor and silly.
paragraphs.name: aaec

virtuals.subtitle: Death changes your perspective on everything. Suddenly everything else in life seems so minor and silly.

content.subtitle: Death changes your perspective on everything. Suddenly everything else in life seems so minor and silly.

fc756db9e167.title: I am so sorry that the system failed you and your wife so badly.

paragraphs.text: I am so sorry that the system failed you and your wife so badly. I believe we need to exercise some very tough love to dramatically increase the number of donors, by making everyone ineligible to receive an organ unless they have themselves been registered as a donor for at least 5 years. If we communicated this message loud and clear at every…
paragraphs.name: 56d8

fffffd5bfd52.title: When I first got my driver’s license I was too young to register to be an organ donor.

paragraphs.text: When I first got my driver’s license I was too young to register to be an organ donor. This just reminded me of how important it is and how it’s something I still need to go back & do. Your story was deeply moving, albeit heartbreaking. It does a great job illustrating the failures of our transplant system. Hopefully everyone who reads this story…

d414ce41101f.title: Thank you so much for sharing your experience.

paragraphs.text: Thank you so much for sharing your experience. My friend’s mom just died the same way, at 55, on the liver transplant list in California. I hope everyone who reads this will take action to become a donor and save someone like Tanya.
paragraphs.name: fb2b
